title: Impulse due to time varying force

content.question: The net force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on a particle as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by the equation <math alttext="F equals 6 k, t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive constant in units of <math alttext="newtons per square second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>N/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>. Which of the following could represent the change in momentum <math alttext="delta p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
